message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study combines data from the Food Security Information Network and the World Food Program Vulnerability Analysis and Mapping branch in East Africa.", "dataset": ["Food Security Information Network", "World Food Program Vulnerability Analysis and Mapping"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from both the Demographic and Health Surveys and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys conducted in Southeast Asia, we estimate the magnitude and gender-specific distribution of child stunting in the region.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This research uses a unique dataset on firms in Mexico, which includes custom information on international trade activities and the Economic Census data collected every five years.", "dataset": ["custom information on international trade activities", "Economic Census data"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We combine household survey data collected in partnership with the government and social media data on migration stories to examine the relationship between migration and mental health outcomes in Northern Central America.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "social media data"], "topic": ["Migration", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the dynamics of carbon stocks in oil palm plantations using datasets on soil carbon stock changes under different management practices and remote sensing imagery for land cover change detection.", "dataset": ["datasets on soil carbon stock changes", "remote sensing imagery"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we use panel data on firms from the World Bank Enterprise Survey and satellite measurements of greenness derived from Landsat imagery to investigate the impact of agglomeration economies on green productivity.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "Landsat imagery"], "topic": ["Environment", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a dataset linking satellite-based measures of economic activity with microdata from household surveys in sub-Saharan Africa to study the relationship between access to electricity and poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["satellite-based measures of economic activity", "microdata from household surveys"], "topic": ["Energy", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This article uses a national dataset on air quality monitoring sites and daily meteorological data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to examine the effectiveness of air pollution policies in improving ambient air quality in the United States.", "dataset": ["national dataset on air quality monitoring sites", "National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration"], "topic": ["Environment", "Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "Using a panel dataset of firms in Ethiopia and survey data that captures informal worker-firm interactions, we evaluate the contribution of informal employment to firm performance and productivity.", "dataset": ["panel dataset of firms in Ethiopia", "survey data"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we use the International Energy Agency's global energy and CO2 emissions database and the World Bank's Global Financial Inclusion Database to investigate the role of financial inclusion in energy access for poor households in developing countries.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency's global energy and CO2 emissions database", "World Bank's Global Financial Inclusion Database"], "topic": ["Energy", "Financial Inclusion"]}]
